soc.game

Class SOCGameOptionSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.game.SOCGameOptionSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<SOCGameOption>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SOCServerGameOptionSet

    public class SOCGameOptionSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<SOCGameOption>
    A set of SOCGameOptions, either those of a game, or all possible Known Options at a server or client: SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions().

    Internally this is a Map whose keys are the options' SOCVersionedItem.keys.

    Before v2.4.50 such sets were represented by Map<String, SOCGameOption> and these methods were part of SOCGameOption. So, some methods here are marked @since earlier version numbers. Many classes still use the Map format for simplicity: Use getAll() for a lightweight Map of the set.

    Known Options

    Methods to work with a set of Known Options:

    Synchronizing options between server/client versions

    • optionsForVersion(int)
    • optionsNewerThanVersion(int, boolean, boolean)
    • adjustOptionsToKnown(SOCGameOptionSet, boolean, SOCFeatureSet,Map)
    • SOCGameOption.packKnownOptionsToString(SOCGameOptionSet, boolean, boolean)
    • SOCGameOption.parseOptionsToSet(String, SOCGameOptionSet)
    • SOCGameOption.getMaxIntValueForVersion(String, int)
    • SOCGameOption.getMaxEnumValueForVersion(String, int)
    • SOCGameOption.trimEnumForVersion(SOCGameOption, int)

    Individual Options

    • getKnownOption(String, boolean)
    • addKnownOption(SOCGameOption)
    • setKnownOptionCurrentValue(SOCGameOption)

    Options available only when Activated or when client has a Feature

    • optionsNotSupported(SOCFeatureSet)
    • optionsTrimmedForSupport(SOCFeatureSet)
    • optionsWithFlag(int, int)
    • activate(String)
    Since:
    2.4.50
    Author:
    Jeremy D. Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

      • K__EXT_BOT

        public static final java.lang.String K__EXT_BOT
        An "extra" option key _EXT_BOT available for robot development. Available for third-party bot developers: Not used by JSettlers core itself. Can hold a string of data which is sent to all robot clients joining a game, entered on the server command line or properties file. A third-party bot might want to use this option's value to configure its behavior or debug settings. Maximum length of this option's value is SOCGameOption.TEXT_OPTION_MAX_LENGTH.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        K__EXT_CLI, K__EXT_GAM, Constant Field Values

      • K__EXT_CLI

        public static final java.lang.String K__EXT_CLI
        An "extra" option key _EXT_CLI available for client development. Available for third-party developers: Not used by JSettlers core itself. Can hold a string of data which is sent to all clients, entered on the server command line or properties file. Maximum length of this option's value is SOCGameOption.TEXT_OPTION_MAX_LENGTH.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        K__EXT_BOT, K__EXT_GAM, Constant Field Values

      • K__EXT_GAM

        public static final java.lang.String K__EXT_GAM
        An "extra" option key _EXT_GAM available for game development. Available for third-party developers: Not used by JSettlers core itself. Can hold a string of data which is sent to the game at all clients, entered on the server command line or properties file. Maximum length of this option's value is SOCGameOption.TEXT_OPTION_MAX_LENGTH.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        K__EXT_BOT, K__EXT_CLI, Constant Field Values

      • add

        public boolean add(SOCGameOption opt)
        Add this option to the set, replacing any previous option there with the same opt.key. If you need the replaced previous option, call put(SOCGameOption) instead.
        Parameters:
        opt - Option to add by key; not null. May be any type, including SOCGameOption.OTYPE_UNKNOWN.
        Returns:
        True if set didn't already contain an option with that key
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if opt is null
        See Also:
        remove(String), addKnownOption(SOCGameOption)

      • put

        public SOCGameOption put(SOCGameOption opt)
        Put this option into the set, replacing any previous option there with the same opt.key. If you don't need the previous option, you can call add(SOCGameOption) instead.
        Parameters:
        opt - Option to add by key; not null. May be any type, including SOCGameOption.OTYPE_UNKNOWN.
        Returns:
        Previously contained option with that key, or null if none
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if opt is null
        See Also:
        get(String), remove(String), addKnownOption(SOCGameOption)

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCGameOption> getAll()

      • isOptionSet

        public boolean isOptionSet(java.lang.String optKey)
        Is this boolean-valued game option currently set to true?

        Before v2.4.50 this method was SOCGame.isGameOptionSet(opts, optKey).

        Parameters:
        optKey - Name of a SOCGameOption of type OTYPE_BOOL, OTYPE_INTBOOL or OTYPE_ENUMBOOL
        Returns:
        True if option's boolean value is set, false if not set or not defined in this set of options
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:

      • setBoolOption

        public void setBoolOption(java.lang.String boKey,
                          SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Within this set, include a boolean option and make it true. If the option object isn't already in the set, it will be cloned from knownOpts.
        Parameters:
        boKey - Key name for boolean option to set
        knownOpts - Set of Known Options, if needed for adding the option
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if boKey isn't in the set and doesn't exist in knownOpts
        Since:

        See Also:

      • setIntOption

        public void setIntOption(java.lang.String ioKey,
                         int ivalue,
                         boolean bvalue,
                         SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts)
                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Within this set, include an int or intbool option and set its value. If the option object doesn't exist in this set, it will be cloned from knownOpts.
        Parameters:
        ioKey - Key name for int option to set
        ivalue - Set option to this int value
        bvalue - Set option to this boolean value (ignored if option type not intbool)
        knownOpts - Set of Known Options, if needed for adding the option
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if ioKey isn't in the set and doesn't exist in knownOpts
        Since:
        1.1.17
        See Also:
        getOptionIntValue(String), setBoolOption(String, SOCGameOptionSet)

      • getOptionIntValue

        public int getOptionIntValue(java.lang.String optKey)
        What is this integer game option's current value?

        Does not reference SOCGameOption.getBoolValue(), only the int value, so this will return a value even if the bool value is false.

        Parameters:
        optKey - A SOCGameOption of type OTYPE_INT, OTYPE_INTBOOL, OTYPE_ENUM or OTYPE_ENUMBOOL
        Returns:
        Option's current intValue, or 0 if not defined in the set of options; OTYPE_ENUM's and _ENUMBOOL's choices give an intVal in range 1 to n.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        isOptionSet(String), getOptionIntValue(String, int, boolean), getOptionStringValue(String)

      • getOptionIntValue

        public int getOptionIntValue(java.lang.String optKey,
                             int defValue,
                             boolean onlyIfBoolSet)
        What is this integer game option's current value?

        Can optionally reference SOCGameOption.getBoolValue(), not only the int value.

        Parameters:
        optKey - A SOCGameOption of type OTYPE_INT, OTYPE_INTBOOL, OTYPE_ENUM or OTYPE_ENUMBOOL
        defValue - Default value to use if optKey not defined
        onlyIfBoolSet - Check the option's SOCGameOption.getBoolValue() too; if false, return defValue. Do not set this parameter if the type doesn't use a boolean component.
        Returns:
        Option's current intValue, or defValue if not defined in the set of options; OTYPE_ENUM's and _ENUMBOOL's choices give an intVal in range 1 to n.
        Since:
        1.1.14
        See Also:
        isOptionSet(String), getOptionIntValue(String), getOptionStringValue(String)

      • getOptionStringValue

        public java.lang.String getOptionStringValue(java.lang.String optKey)
        What is this string game option's current value?
        Parameters:
        optKey - A SOCGameOption of type OTYPE_STR or OTYPE_STRHIDE
        Returns:
        Option's current getStringValue or null if not defined in this set of options
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        isOptionSet(String), getOptionIntValue( String )

      • getKnownOption

        public SOCGameOption getKnownOption(java.lang.String key,
                                    boolean clone)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Get information about a known option. See SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions() for a summary of each known option. Will return the info if known, even if option has SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN.

        Before v2.4.50 this method was SOCGameOption.getOption(key, clone).

        Parameters:
        key - Option key
        clone - True if a copy of the option is needed; set this true unless you're sure you won't be changing any fields of its original object, which is a shared copy in a static namekey->object map.
        Returns:
        information about a known option, or null if none with that key
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if clone but the object couldn't be cloned; this isn't expected to ever happen
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        addKnownOption(SOCGameOption), setKnownOptionCurrentValue(SOCGameOption)

      • addKnownOption

        public boolean addKnownOption(SOCGameOption onew)
        Add a new known option (presumably received from a server of newer or older version), or update the option's information.
        Parameters:
        onew - New option, or a changed version of an option we already know. If onew.optType == SOCGameOption.OTYPE_UNKNOWN, will remove from this Known set. If this option is already known and the old copy has a SOCGameOption.getChangeListener(), that listener is copied to onew.
        Returns:
        true if it's new, false if we already had that key and it was updated
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        getKnownOption(String, boolean), setKnownOptionCurrentValue(SOCGameOption)

      • activate

        public void activate(java.lang.String optKey)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        In a set of Known Options, activate an "inactive" known option: Drop its SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN flag and add SOCGameOption.FLAG_ACTIVATED. Does nothing if already activated. See SOCGameOption class javadoc for more about Inactive Options.

        Since SOCGameOption.optFlags field is final, copies to a new option object with updated flags, replacing the old one in the set of known options.

        To get the list of currently activated options compatible with a certain client version, call knownOpts.optionsWithFlag(FLAG_ACTIVATED, cliVersion).

        At the server, activate needed options before any clients connect. Do so by editing/overriding SOCServer#serverUp() to call this method, or setting property SOCServer#PROP_JSETTLERS_GAMEOPTS_ACTIVATE.

        Parameters:
        optKey - Known game option's alphanumeric keyname
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if optKey isn't a known game option, or if that option has neither SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN nor SOCGameOption.FLAG_ACTIVATED

      • setKnownOptionCurrentValue

        public void setKnownOptionCurrentValue(SOCGameOption ocurr)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        In a set of Known Options, set the current value(s) of an option based on the current value(s) of another object ocurr with the same key. If there is no known option with oCurr.key, it is ignored and nothing is set.
        Parameters:
        ocurr - Option with the requested current value. ocurr's value field contents are copied to the known option's values, the ocurr reference won't be added to the known option set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if string value is not permitted; note that int values outside of range are silently clipped, and will not throw this exception.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        getKnownOption(String, boolean)

      • optionsNewerThanVersion

        public java.util.List<SOCGameOption> optionsNewerThanVersion(int vers,
                                                             boolean checkValues,
                                                             boolean trimEnums)
        Compare a set of options against the specified version. Make a list of all which are new or changed since that version.

        This method has 2 modes, because it's called for 2 different purposes:

        • sync client-server Known Option set info, in general: checkValues == false
        • check if client can create game with a specific set of option values: checkValues == true, call on game's proposed Set of game opts instead of Known Opts.
          Before calling this method, server should call adjustOptionsToKnown(SOCGameOptionSet, boolean, SOCFeatureSet,Map) to help validate option values.
        See checkValues for method's behavior in each mode.

        Game option names:
        When running this at the client (vers is the older remote server's version), some of the returned too-new options have long names that can't be sent to a v1.x.xx server (vers < SOCGameOption.VERSION_FOR_LONGER_OPTNAMES). You must check for this and remove them before sending them to the remote server. Game option names sent to 1.x.xx servers must be 3 characters or less, alphanumeric, no underscores ('_').

        When running at the server, we will never send an option whose name is invalid to v1.x.xx clients, because the SOCGameOption constructors enforce minVers >= 2000 when the name is longer than 3 characters or contains '_'.

        Parameters:
        vers - Version to compare known options against
        checkValues - Which mode: Check options' current values and SOCVersionedItem.minVersion, not their SOCVersionedItem.lastModVersion? An option's minimum version can increase based on its value; see SOCGameOption.getMinVersion(Map).

        If false, returns list of any game options to send to older server or client vers. Ignores any option with SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN. Adds all options with SOCGameOption.FLAG_ACTIVATED having minVersion <= vers, ignoring their lastModVersion in case activation is the opt's only recent change.
        If checkValues and trimEnums both false, assumes is a client-side call and also adds any opts with SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY to the returned list.

        If true, any returned items are in this Set but too new for client vers: Game creation should be rejected. Does not check SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN in this mode; use adjustOptionsToKnown(SOCGameOptionSet, boolean, SOCFeatureSet,Map) for that check.

        trimEnums - For enum-type options where minVersion changes based on current value, should we remove too-new values from the returned option info? This lets us send only the permitted values to an older client. Also trims int-type options' max value where needed (example: "PL").
        Returns:
        List of the newer (added or changed) SOCGameOptions, or null if all are known and unchanged since vers.
        Note: May include options with SOCVersionedItem.minVersion > vers if client has asked about them by name.
        Since:
        1.1.07
        See Also:
        optionsForVersion(int), optionsTrimmedForSupport(SOCFeatureSet)

      • optionsForVersion

        public java.util.List<SOCGameOption> optionsForVersion(int vers)
        In a set of Known Options, get all options valid at version vers. If necessary, trims enum value ranges or int value ranges if range was smaller at vers, like optionsNewerThanVersion(int, boolean, boolean) does.

        If vers from a client is newer than this version of SOCGameOption, will return all options known at this version, which may not include all of the newer version's options. Client game-option negotiation handles this by having the newer client send all its new (added or changed) option keynames to the older server to allow, adjust, or reject.

        Will omit any option that has SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN.

        Parameters:
        vers - Version to compare options against
        Returns:
        List of all SOCGameOptions valid at version vers, or null if none.
        Since:
        2.0.00
        See Also:
        optionsNewerThanVersion(int, boolean, boolean), optionsTrimmedForSupport(SOCFeatureSet)

      • adjustOptionsToKnown

        public java.lang.StringBuilder adjustOptionsToKnown(SOCGameOptionSet knownOpts,
                                                    boolean doServerPreadjust,
                                                    SOCFeatureSet limitedCliFeats,
                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCScenario> scenarioMap)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        NOTE: only called by server Compare this set of options with known-good values, and optionally apply options from the set's scenario (game option "SC") if present.

        If any values are above/below maximum/minimum, clip to the max/min value given in knownOpts. If any are unknown or inactive, return a description. Will still check (and clip) the known ones. If any options are default, and unset/blank, and their SOCGameOption.FLAG_DROP_IF_UNUSED flag is set, remove them from this set. For SOCGameOption.OTYPE_INTBOOL and SOCGameOption.OTYPE_ENUMBOOL, both the integer and boolean values are checked against defaults.

        If doServerPreadjust is true, then the server might also change some option values before creating the game, for overall consistency of the set of options. This is a server-side equivalent to the client-side SOCGameOption.ChangeListeners. For example, if "PL" (number of players) > 4, but "PLB" (use 6-player board) is not set, doServerPreadjust wil set the "PLB" option. doServerPreadjust will also remove any game-internal options the client has sent.

        Before any other adjustments when doServerPreadjust, will check for the game scenario option "SC". If that option is set, call SOCServerScenario.getScenario(String); the scenario name must be known. Then, add that scenario's .scOpts into this set. Scenario option values always overwrite those already in the set, except for "VP" where current value (if any) is kept.

        Client-side gameopt code also assumes all scenarios use the sea board, and sets game option "SBL" when a scenario is chosen by the user.

        Before v2.4.50 this method was SOCGameOption.adjustOptionsToKnown(newOpts, knownOpts, boolean).

        Parameters:
        knownOpts - Set of known SOCGameOptions to check against; not null. Caller can use SOCServerGameOptionSet.getAllKnownOptions() if they don't already have such a set.
        doServerPreadjust - If true, we're calling from the server before creating a game; pre-adjust any values for consistency. This is a server-side equivalent to the client-side SOCGameOption.ChangeListeners. (Added in 1.1.13)
        limitedCliFeats - For doServerPreadjust, client's set of features if limited compared to the standard client; null if client doesn't have limited feats. See SOCClientData.hasLimitedFeats for details.
        Returns:
        null if all are known; or, a human-readable problem description if:
        • any option in this set not a Known Option or is inactive (has SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN)
        • or an opt's type differs from that in knownOpts
        • or an opt's SOCVersionedItem.lastModVersion differs from in knownOpts
        • or an opt requires a SOCGameOption.getClientFeature() which the client doesn't have (checked only if limitedCliFeats != null and doServerPreadjust)
        • set has option "SC" but its scenario keyname isn't known by SOCServerScenario.getScenario(String)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if knownOpts is null
        Since:
        1.1.07

      • optionsNotSupported

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCGameOption> optionsNotSupported(SOCFeatureSet cliFeats)
        In a set of options or Known Options, do any require client features not supported by a limited client's SOCFeatureSet? Checks each option having a SOCGameOption.getClientFeature().

        Doesn't check integer value of features like sc (SOCFeatureSet.getValue(String, int)): Use SOCGame.checkClientFeatures(SOCFeatureSet, boolean) for that.

        Parameters:
        cliFeats - Client's limited subset of optional features, from SOCClientData.feats, or null or empty set if no features
        Returns:
        Map of known options not supported by cliFeats, or null if all known options are supported. Each map key is its option value's key.
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        optionsTrimmedForSupport(SOCFeatureSet)

      • optionsTrimmedForSupport

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,SOCGameOption> optionsTrimmedForSupport(SOCFeatureSet cliFeats)
        In a set of options or Known Options, do any require changes for a limited client's SOCFeatureSet? For example, clients without SOCFeatureSet.CLIENT_6_PLAYERS limit "max players" to 4.

        Assumes client is new enough that its version wouldn't also cause trimming of those same options' values by optionsNewerThanVersion(int, boolean, boolean) or optionsForVersion(int).

        Parameters:
        cliFeats - Client's limited subset of optional features, from SOCClientData.feats, or null or empty set if no features
        Returns:
        Map of trimmed known options, or null if no trimming was needed. Each map key is its option value's key.
        Since:
        2.4.00
        See Also:
        optionsNotSupported(SOCFeatureSet), SOCGameOption.getMaxIntValueForVersion(String, int)

      • optionsWithFlag

        public SOCGameOptionSet optionsWithFlag(int flagMask,
                                        int minVers)
        Find all opts in this set having the specified flag(s) and optional minimum version, or all Known Options when called on a server or client's set of Known Options.

        Some uses:

        • SOCGameOption.FLAG_3RD_PARTY: Find any Third-party Options defined at client, to ask server if it knows them too. Client calls this as part of connect to server, ignoring minVersion so all are asked about.
        • SOCGameOption.FLAG_ACTIVATED: Find any Activated Options compatible with client version. Server calls this as part of client connect, with minVers = client version.
        Ignores any option with SOCGameOption.FLAG_INACTIVE_HIDDEN unless that's part of flagMask.

        If calling at server and the connecting client has limited features, assumes has already called optionsNotSupported(SOCFeatureSet) and optionsTrimmedForSupport(SOCFeatureSet). So this method filters only by minVersion, not by feature requirement or any other field.

        Parameters:
        flagMask - Flag(s) to check for; SOCGameOption.hasFlag(int) return value is the filter
        minVers - Minimum compatible version to look for, same format as Version.versionNumber(), or 0 to ignore opt.minVersion
        Returns:
        Map of found options compatible with minVers, or null if none. Each map key is its option value's key.
        See Also:
        activate(String)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Human-readable contents of the Set: Returns its game options Map#toString().
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
